Citation: Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., De Keersmaecker, W., Souverijns, N., Brockmann, C., Quast, R., Wevers, J., Grosu, A., Paccini, A., Vergnaud, S., Cartus, O., Santoro, M., Fritz, S., Georgieva, I., Lesiv, M., Carter, S., Herold, M., Li, Linlin, Tsendbazar, N.E., Ramoino, F., Arino, O., 2021. ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100. (doi:10.5281/zenodo.5571936)
Description: The European Space Agency (ESA) WorldCover 10 m 2020 product provides a global land cover map for 2020 at 10 m resolution based on Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 data. The WorldCover product comes with 11 land cover classes and has been generated in the framework of the ESA WorldCover project, part of the 5th Earth Observation Envelope Programme (EOEP-5) of the European Space Agency.
Methodology: In this data layer, no processing has been done on top of the raw data layer from Google Earth Engine. In case of exporting in a different resolution, data values are resampled using mode (majority). The layer is clipped to the user defined location. For the algorithms, please check out: export_landuse() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils

Citation: Pesaresi, Martino; Ehrilch, Daniele; Florczyk, Aneta J.; Freire, Sergio; Julea, Andreea; Kemper, Thomas; Soille, Pierre; Syrris, Vasileios (2015): GHS built-up grid, derived from Landsat, multitemporal (1975, 1990, 2000, 2014). European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) [Dataset] PID: https://data.europa.eu/89h/jrc-ghsl-ghs_built_ldsmt_globe_r2015b, Pesaresi, Martino; Ehrlich, Daniele; Florczyk, Aneta J.; Freire, Sergio; Julea, Andreea; Kemper, Thomas; Soille, Pierre; Syrris, Vasileios (2015): GHS built-up confidence grid, derived from Landsat, multitemporal (1975, 1990, 2000, 2014). European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) [Dataset] PID: https://data.europa.eu/89h/jrc-ghsl-ghs_built_ldsmtcnfd_globe_r2015b, Pesaresi, Martino; Ehrlich, Daniele; Florczyk, Aneta J.; Freire, Sergio; Julea, Andreea; Kemper, Thomas; Soille, Pierre; Syrris, Vasileios (2015): GHS built-up datamask grid derived from Landsat, multitemporal (1975, 1990, 2000, 2014). European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) [Dataset] PID: https://data.europa.eu/89h/jrc-ghsl-ghs_built_ldsmtdm_globe_r2015b
Description: Global Population Grids at 250 m Resolution (original) on 2015. The pixel values represents the number of people per cell. The GHSL relies on the design and implementation of new spatial data mining technologies allowing to automatically process and extract analytics and knowledge from large amount of heterogeneous data including: global, fine-scale satellite image data streams, census data, and crowd sources or volunteered geographic information sources. The Global Human Settlement Layer (GHSL) project is supported by the European Commission, Joint Research Center, and Directorate-General for Regional and Urban Policy. The GHSL produces new global spatial information, evidence-based analytics, and knowledge describing the human presence in the planet.
Methodology: This is a data layer showing population count per pixel from GHSL 2015 dataset. No further processing has been performed on top of the layer. For the algorithms, please check out: export_population() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils

Citation: Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., De Keersmaecker, W., Souverijns, N., Brockmann, C., Quast, R., Wevers, J., Grosu, A., Paccini, A., Vergnaud, S., Cartus, O., Santoro, M., Fritz, S., Georgieva, I., Lesiv, M., Carter, S., Herold, M., Li, Linlin, Tsendbazar, N.E., Ramoino, F., Arino, O., 2021. ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100. (doi:10.5281/zenodo.5571936)
Description: This data layer provides ratio of urban surface in the ESA World Cover dataset. It is derived by counting ratio of urban category (including artificial structures such as roads and buildings) within a 5km radius circular kernel. Resampling is done based on mean. For the algorithms, please check out: export_urban_density() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils
Methodology: This is a data layer showing urban density from World Cover data. Urban class are selected and density is calculated based on 5 km circular radius urban pixel count / total pixels. For the algorithms, please check out: export_urban_density() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils

Description: MODIS average 8-day land surface temperature (LST) in a 1200 x 1200 kilometer grid. Each pixel value in MOD11A2 is a simple average of all the corresponding MOD11A1 LST pixels collected within that 8 day period. Derived from MODIS satellite imagery, this data layer provides estimated day-time land surface temperature (degree Celsius) for the three summer months (Jun - Sep (northern hemisphere) / Dec to March (southern hemisphere)) for a specific time period. The values are interpolated and resampled using median. For the algorithms, please check out: export_summer_lst() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils
Methodology: This data layer utilize MODIS daily imagery with its band "LST_Day_1km" without data filtering. Required scale factor and offset are applied to the pixel values. Resampling and interpolation are done using median. For the algorithms, please check out: export_summer_lst() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils

Description: MODIS average 8-day land surface temperature (LST) in a 1200 x 1200 kilometer grid. Each pixel value in MOD11A2 is a simple average of all the corresponding MOD11A1 LST pixels collected within that 8 day period. Derived from MODIS satellite imagery, this data layer provides estimated night-time land surface temperature (degree Celsius) for the three summer months (Jun - Sep (northern hemisphere) / Dec to March (southern hemisphere)) for a specific time period. The values are interpolated and resampled using median. For the algorithms, please check out: export_summer_lst_night() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils
Methodology: This data layer utilize MODIS daily imagery with its band "LST_Night_1km" without data filtering. Required scale factor and offset are applied to the pixel values. Resampling and interpolation are done using median. For the algorithms, please check out: export_summer_lst_night() from https://github.com/pinkychow1010/EO-Climate-Hazard-Analysis/blob/master/explorer_utils
